column2: Djinn come in many forms none more feared and revered across Araby then the Serpent.
This Djinn has given in to the burning power of Aqshy, though those that burn so bright do not burn long.

Ibn Naggazar was a brilliant, if somewhat maniacal Arabyan srcerer.Whilst it is unknown whether his madness sprang from isolation,too many attemt at creating intoxicating elixirs or the honeyed promises of whispering daemons.There can be np doubt he was utterly insane.

Inside this ornate staff decorated with snake motifs is bound a malignant and ancient Serpent Djinn, imprisoned by powerful enchantments woven by Jaffar. Only Jaffar's will is strong enough to temporarily unleash it upon his enemies on the abattlefield.
Jaffar's natural gravitas coupled with his sorcerous might produce an oppresive aura of dread and authority around him that none under his command can resist.
